etymologies: 1940s: from Spanish (of Uruguayan origin), literally ‘basket’, based on Latin canistrum ‘basket’ (see canister)

definitions: a card game resembling rummy, using two packs. It is usually played by two pairs of partners, and the aim is to collect sets (or melds) of cards.
shortDefinitions: card game resembling rummy, using two packs

definitions: a meld of seven cards in the game of canasta.
shortDefinitions: meld of seven cards in canasta
